Name: Devashish Yaduvanshi

Review: Like is chill here at GCET, good amount of fest and cultural activities are held on timely basis to support students to get themselves extracurricular well prepared, coding fest were organised and a good coding culture is seen here, a wide variety of writers can be found at the college library, classrooms are big spacious and well furnished in sports fest are organised timely where sports like football, badminton, hockey, volleyball, cricket, basketball etc are played, there is a social group called 'daksh' which is runned by cse dept students in our college which encourage teamwork and unity among selves.

Name: Monika S
Heading: Why one must choose M.O.P for Journalism degree
Review: It is a well know fact that M.O.P is one of the reputable colleges in Chennai and it offers the best quality education. I chose this course since the college provides the best class curriculum and exposure. Journalism in MOP is always popular in and around Chennai. The college provides an exclusive course curriculum focusing mainly on real world scenarios. The college provides well trained and educated faculties. The Head of the Journalism Department is a Doctorate and other faculties also are two plus degree holders with exemptional training skills. The strength of each class is around 70. And the number of teachers for the Journalism Department is around 6. though the number of faculties is less in number the quality of education is not compromised. The teaching methods are very interactive and classes are mostly thought with presentations and case studies. The Internals and main exams are conducted as per the schedule and the exam corrections will be strict and not lenient.

Name: Aman Tyagi
College: Makhanlal Chaturvedi National University of Journalism and Communication - [MCRPSV]
Heading: Makhanlal University- A true journalism University
Review:
It has two campuses. One is an old campus in which current academic work is going on and another one is a new campus that is under construction and expected to be completed by July 2022. The new campus will be fully open for all activities in July 2022. The new campus is spread in 50 acres of land which has hostels, separate buildings for different departments, a large auditorium, indoor games building, etc. Right now, academic activities are going on the old campus which has two 6 storey buildings. Both campuses have large libraries with very rich resources of books, journals, newspaper archive sections, etc.
Classrooms are well cleaned and ventilated and wifi facility.

Name: Rishika Rawat
Heading: Ipec Insight
Review:
I chose this course because it gives me an overview of how things are really going on and what basis and criteria a structure are designed so that it remains safe throughout its lifespan. And the best thing about civil engineering is that you can literally see every single thing/ construction going around you and relate it to your knowledge. 
The faculty-student ratio is pretty good, not only in my branch, rather in every branch of engineering, and if the college sees any differences in that ratio it always tries to recruit new professionals to teach. 
Qualification of teachers are pretty good because almost every teacher have a
master's degree some even have double masters or PhDs. I won't say that every teacher's method of teaching was excellent because I think that every person has a different understanding level and different way of teaching.
Final exams are quite difficult and you really have to study well for that otherwise you'll definitely fail.

Rtu is one of the best universities.

Name: Vasudev

Coming to the college, the student's strength is nearly 1000 in the college whereas the faculty strength is nearly 50 to 70 and we cannot give our review on qualifications of the faculty as we don't know about their qualifications. Any how they are highly qualified we think but the teaching quality of the faculty is good. Coming to the examination point of view, the board will conduct mid-term examinations for every 2 months and 1-semester examinations for every 6 months. The examination pattern is 60 marks in each subject for the external examination and 40 marks will be from internals like assignments, fieldwork and from tests, etc. The examination difficulty level is medium and will be very easy in some subjects and will be very tough sometimes depending upon the difficulty level of the subject.
